alert.note: Alert for Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Union County in south central Arkansas and northern Union Parishes through 900 PM CST... At 800 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hilo to near Bernice. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Huttig, Farmerville, Bernice, Strong, Cooley, Lapile, Moro Bay State Park, Marion, Felsenthal, Spearsville, New London, Aurelle, Oakland, Haile, Linville, Cecil, Litroe and Shiloh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for south central Arkansas...and north central Louisiana.
